text:
We've been an existing customer—all
in with AWS—for

approximately five years now,
and we've continually been

migrating workloads
to AWS and building new products on AWS.

When we started migrating products to AWS,
we leveraged

the lift-and-shift model
where we didn't change a whole lot.

And as we've gotten more mature
and more experience, we've begun

transforming our products to become cloud
native during their migration.

We have grown over the years
through acquisitions.

We use a whole bunch of different
technology stacks,

and it's really hard to consolidate
or change those technology stacks.

It's very common, and it's something
that we didn't reinvent the wheel on.

but AWS provided us the tools
to make it easy to standardize.

If I had any advice to offer my peers
within the industry,

it would be to jump all in with AWS
and leverage their technologies.

Don't do the undifferentiated
heavy lifting yourself.

Let AWS take that on and really focus
on your business problems.
